lines.text: Tansi is your only friend in here
You were taken here together,
along with many others
Only difference between then and now,
is that you don't need to speak so quietly here
Would you like to go to sleep?
So you do.
Where are they taking the baby?
They will kill it, I'm sure
Tansi,
tell me a story, please
Ah!
You're too old for stories, my sister
Do you know the story of the kente cloth?
You've heard it several times before
Two Asante men went out into the forest one day
They were weavers by trade,
and they had gone out to hunt for meat
When they got to the forest to collect their traps,
they were met by Anansi, the mischievous spider
He was spinning a magnificent web
They watched him, studied him,
and soon realized that a spider's web was a unique and beautiful thing,
and that a spider's technique is flawless
They went home and decided to weave cloth,
the same way Anansi weaves his web
From that, kente was born
You are a fine storyteller
Tansi laughed.
It might be time to go to bed.
Two Asante hunters went into the forest
and they saw the mischievous spider Anansi weaving his web
Hunters?
No, no
They were weavers, Esi.
They went to check their traps,
but weaving was their craft
But if you know it so well...
why don't you tell it?
Okay then...
Anansi's web was...
unique and beautiful
So they went home and decided to weave cloth the way Anansi did,
and so kente was born
annoying and ugly
And they got so mad that they decided to come back another day,
to kill Anansi
boring and repetitive
So they went back home disappointed,
and decided to never return to the forest
Yes,
even in the forest,
beauty can be made
I must say,
You're a fine storyteller, Esi.
I'm glad you remembered my story
You speak like someone who has lost something
I'll tell it again sometime,
but I'm glad you tried
I'll admit,
it's not exactly how I remember it
Nonetheless,
I'm glad you tried
Aufa's whole body convulses to the violent screams of her sorrows
It's something being torn from a human throat
She's naked and weeping,
because she's lost something very important to her
She's lost something very important to her
They have taken her last source of joy
You'd like to console her,
but you fear she is too far gone
It might be best to leave her alone
You kneel beside her,
and carefully reach for her shoulder
Don't touch me!
You let them take her!
Her hands strike your chest,
weak but furious
She doesn't want to talk to you right now
The baby's cries are subdued by the mud walls
A soldier entered the dungeon
Nfye ttyuew aghruheriu kfj sndjf ptesdf lenfsufs
nobody understood the words he spoke
Nfye ttyuew aghruheriu kfj sndjf ptesdf lenfsufs
he spoke louder as if we would suddenly understand his language
It's very cold in the dungeon
It might be time to go to sleep
